GoDaddy doesn’t accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

Senior Software Engineer (Rails Focused)

Full-Time

Remote (overlap with EST working hours required)*


About Impactive

Impactive (formerly Outvote), backed by YCombinator and Higher Ground Labs, was founded in 2017 as a get-out-the-vote tool for Democrats. The Impactive product has since expanded to become an all-in-one hub for digital organizing, powering the organizing efforts of some of the country’s largest progressive organizations.

In the 2018 midterms, volunteers contacted over 1 million voters using Impactive. In 2020, we scaled significantly to meet the demand of this unprecedented election cycle. We’ve worked with over 500 clients nationwide, and volunteers have sent over 150 million text messages on behalf of Planned Parenthood, the DCCC, SEIU, Community Change, When We All Vote, Greenpeace, and campaigns up and down the ballot. Our work has been featured in The New York Times, Washington Post, TechCrunch, Fast Company, and many more. 

In 2021, Impactive will expand its platform further into nonprofit, advocacy, and additional markets. This will be an exciting time to play a critical role in helping shape the direction for what's coming next. We will continue to prioritize our progressive values while building a feature-rich platform that will broaden our reach across the impact space.



About the Role

Impactive’s Senior Software Engineer (Rails Focused) will be responsible for owning and maintaining the entire Impactive backend. They will write code and contribute to the development process, collaborating with the CTO, Lead Engineer, and other employees and contractors on everything from planning technical requirements and design to testing and implementation.



Responsibilities
  • Plan technical solutions. Outline the implementation details from product specification documents given the current state of the Rails stack and performance and security implications.
  • Implement new features. Work with Impactive’s Head of Product, Lead Engineer, and CTO on the development process: taking off Github issues ready for development, putting in a pull request, handing off for staging deployment, QA, and ultimately production deployment.
  • Maintenance and troubleshooting. Innovate solutions for client tickets and assist in the bug fixing process.


Preferred Skills and Experience
  • At least five years of experience working in a consumer-facing production environment.
  • At least five years of experience working with Ruby on Rails + Sidekiq + RSpec.
  • Optional experience working with Ruby and Rails application profiling and performance, Rails application security, Go, Elasticsearch, AWS, Datadog, Github, React, React Native, Redis, Heroku, or New Relic.
  • Passionate about politics and activism, social impact and responsibility, and volunteering and fundraising for social good. 
We don’t expect individual candidates to have expertise across all of these areas—we’re looking for candidates that are particularly strong in a few areas, and are excited to learn in others.

We eagerly accept applicants with diverse backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. Impactive is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate our employees’ differences, and know that differences⁠ — of all kinds⁠ — make us infinitely stronger.



Compensation and Work Environment
  • Salary: $120,000-$170,000 depending on experience
  • Equity: 0.1-0.25%
  • 90-100% of medical and dental insurance premiums paid
  • Quarterly revenue sharing bonus program
  • 401k plan
  • Unlimited PTO with minimum of three weeks off per year
  • Paid parental leave, ranging from 10 weeks at start of employment to 16 weeks for longer-tenured employees
  • Live and work from anywhere, with flexible hours
  • $500 work-from-home equipment stipend at start of employment
  • $500 per quarter professional development stipend
  • $750 per year charitable contribution matching
  • Work with an inspiring and dedicated team of passionate activists and organizers 

* Note that candidates outside of the U.S. would be hired as full-time contractors without medical/dental insurance and 401k.

💡 The opportunity

We’re looking for a creative and customer-focused Product Marketing Specialist to join our small but mighty Product Marketing team at Sendible!

If you’re excited about social media and building a B2B SaaS company as it reaches its next stage of growth, this is a fantastic opportunity to get a thorough understanding of all the elements that go into product marketing including sales enablement, market research, and go-to-market strategies. 

As a Product Marketing Specialist at Sendible, you’ll be helping with maximising the adoption of our platform for trialists and improving each user interaction with our product during the trial period. This includes providing a great user experience and increasing our conversion rates through a mixture of video tutorials, in-app onboarding, and email workflows. 

Additionally, you’ll be a part of bringing new features and releases to market, assisting with providing copy and developing launch plans to spread the word about what we’re working on so we can reach new market segments. 

This is an ideal role for someone who has a year or two of experience in product marketing or is pivoting from another role. You’ll be supported by the Head of Product Marketing and collaborate closely with the Marketing, Product, Support, Customer Success, and Development teams. 
 
🤝 About you 

  • You have experience working in SaaS or an understanding of the SaaS work environment.
  • You're a skilled writer with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely. 
  • You’re familiar with different marketing channels and able to modify copy depending on audience and medium. 
  • You believe in the value of social media and its usefulness to a business.
  • You’re a creative thinker with the ability to come up with innovative new ideas and solutions.
  • You’re collaborative and thrive on bringing different groups together. 
  • You’re a self-starter with the ability to proactively take on and manage projects. 
  • You’re customer-obsessed and would love to engage with users.
  • You’re early in your product marketing career or interested in switching to the product marketing field. 
  • You’re eager to learn new skills. 
  • You have an upbeat, proactive attitude and a love for helping others succeed.
  • You’re able to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
  • You’re preferably based in European or US East Coast time zones. 
  • Experience with Hubspot and Pendo is a plus!
We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. 

Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company.

✅ Things you’ll be doing

  • Becoming a product expert on Sendible, knowing the ins and outs of why customers choose and stay with us. 
  • Developing a deep understanding of social media marketing and our customers’ goals.
  • Creating and improving sales enablement materials to help the sales team exceed their goals. 
  • Developing product-led assets including video tutorials to help with automated conversions and onboarding
  • Assisting with the creation of new features and products including providing copy and planning out launches to maximise adoption. 
  • Working closely with the Head of Product Marketing on product positioning and messaging. 

💻 Why work with us

  • Work remotely or from our London HQ and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy).
  • 25 days paid holiday per year, plus one bonus day for your birthday.
  • 12+ weeks fully paid parental leave for both birthing & non-birthing parents*
  • Gear including a laptop and headset. 
  • Annual bonuses based on company and personal performance (if the company does well and you played a big part, you'll be rewarded).
  • Competitive insurance coverage and access to pension or retirement plan*
  • Ongoing team-wide and company-wide virtual social activities and success celebrations. We’ll return to in-person retreats when regulations allow. 
  • Paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  • We love learning! Use your £1000 learning allowance to develop your skills.
  • Gain incredible experience building a truly successful, global SaaS company with a dedicated, small team where you can have a huge impact!

*Eligibility for parental leave, insurance, and pension/retirement plans is dependent on the employee’s location and may vary. 

We have a low staff turnover rate — over 20% of the team has been at Sendible for 5+ years. But, your voice matters to us. 

We like hearing fresh perspectives and appreciate new viewpoints, so you should feel comfortable speaking up and not be afraid to drive change and challenge the status quo. If something sucks and can be done better, we want to hear!

👋 About us 

Sendible is a leading social media management platform built for teams and agencies to collaborate on content, engage with audiences, and report on successes. Our team of 50 is dedicated to partnering with our customers to help them achieve their goals.
  • Sendible was voted as the 20th best product for Marketers in 2021 by G2.
  • Trusted by 30,000+ brand managers and marketers.
Recently listed as one of the "Best Software Companies in EMEA" and classified as a Leader in our category on G2, our mission is to help agencies work closely with their clients to breathe life into their brands using the power of social media. 🚀

🌐 How we work

Sendible is a UK corporation and our head office is based in London but we are distributed with teammates in South Africa, Italy, Latvia, Northern Ireland, Scotland, the Philippines, and the US. 

This is a remote role, but if you're based in London, you’re welcome to work from our HQ which is fully equipped with free fruit and snacks, excellent coffee, standing desks and a pool table. We allow team members to work from wherever they are most productive.

We are part of a larger collective of marketing technology tools called Traject that is backed by Alpine Investors, a People-First private equity company. Traject is made up of 8 brands (Sendible, PLANOLY, Loomly, Grade.us, GatherUp, Cyfe, Traject Data, and Authority Labs) and over 170 employees. Being part of Traject enables us to think strategically, drive cross-sells, and have access to more learning and development opportunities.

Sendible operates largely independently while still participating in some cross-over initiatives. You would be working on the Sendible team with opportunities to collaborate with marketing team members from other brands as well.

⚡ How to get our attention when you apply
 
Please write a cover letter to introduce yourself to us as a colleague and show us what working with you would be like. We value authenticity so be yourself, be creative, and take your time with the application. 
 
Tell us why you want this particular job:
  • What about working at Sendible interests you the most? 
  • Why are you interested in product marketing? 
  • What is the main value of social media for businesses? 
  • Have you ever taught yourself a new skill to complete a job or project?
Join Cecilia, Nico, Veronika, Katey, and Tricia in helping to spread awareness of Sendible and drive new customers to our product!

Here at Beyond, we are passionate about helping short-term rental owners and managers be successful. Backed by the world-class Bessemer Venture Partners, we have grown from a bootstrapped company of a few to the market leader in our category.  We attribute our success to our belief that the people are the most important part of a business and our commitment to being a fantastic place to work.

It's with that in mind that Beyond Pricing is looking to add a Senior DevOps Engineer to our growing team. You will have the opportunity to build tools that make our engineering teams more productive, iterate and improve the infrastructure to scale with our growing business and be an advocate for the technical decision making relating to our engineering team. 

Beyond's Engineering team believes in:

  • Reducing scope - The best way to ship more stuff is to ship less!
  • Shipping early - Getting feedback as early as possible even if the project/feature isn’t 100% there
  • Iterating and improving - Once you got the feedback and there is a need for it, go back and improve the v1
  • Taking ownership - Owning the code you shipped as you are the expert and knows best
  • Driving revenue - At the end of the day we are here to make Beyond a successful business.

As our Senior DevOps Engineer you’ll be responsible for:

  • Operating and supporting mission-critical services in our cloud environment
  • Impacting Beyond success through the impact of CD and DevOps decisions
  • Supporting Senior and Staff engineers on migration projects that involve changes to our infrastructure and monitoring
  • Supporting software teams while continuously working to make the developer experience better
  • Participating in long term planning for infrastructure and process improvements to support company growth

So what kind of person are we looking for in this role? The person who will be successful in this role will be:

  • Curious - You are driven to understand how things work or why they don't. You are interested in finding out how your work impacts our customers and the world they live in.
  • Collaborative - You enjoy exploring and committing as a team, you welcome others' ideas, and you value teamwork and team decision-making over being right and having things going your way.
  • Service-oriented - your passion for helping others be successful is at the core of what motivates you.
  • Resilient - You can adapt and roll up your sleeves to help others. You operate at a stable pace with visibility most of the time and you are ready to embrace change when it happens.

Now that we've told you what the job looks like, here are the qualifications we're looking for in a candidate:

  • 5+ years of experience with one or more of the major cloud providers (GCP, AWS)
  • Expertise in IaC (Terraform, Cloud Formation, GC Deployment Manager)
  • Expertise in running multi-team environments with Continuous Deployment (TBD, Concourse CI, we process 200 production deployments a month
  • Expertise in Docker and containers orchestration (Nomad, Kubernetes)
  • Experience running a variety of migration initiatives such as data strategy rehauls, large codebase decoupling, Information Security and Compliance, ...
  • Experience setting up large scale systems observability (We ingest 3 billion log events a month)
  • Strong proficiency with Linux systems admin and scripting (Bash, Python, Ruby, Golang, ...)
  • Strong proficiency with configuration management (Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
  • Ability to mentor and sponsor others, organize and drive team delivery and help others grow in their technical development


We are passionate about cultivating a diverse team so if you think you have what it takes but don't necessarily meet every point on the job description, please apply anyway!

Company Values: 

We are serious about our core values - We Care, We Are On the Same Team, We Inspire Trust, We Go Beyond, We Ship It - if those resonate with you, and you're ready to work with a team that lives and breathes those values, we want to hear from you.

EEO Statement: 

Beyond is committed to building a workplace that attracts humans of all genders, ethnicities, backgrounds, statuses, and lifestyles. At our core, we care about our people and encourage every employee, partner, and applicant to share their whole self with us. We are respectful of and empathetic towards different viewpoints and believe that our ability to help short-term rental managers succeed relies on us building a dynamic and diverse team. Whoever you are, you can Belong @ Beyond.
APPLY FOR THIS JOB

Our 100% remote team of 200+ CleverPeople are seasoned yet friendly professionals who want to collaborate and welcome you. We have an exciting new opening for a Vetting Engineer - Recruiting Team.


What we're working on
Enterprise companies turn to us to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. The problems we solve every day are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally, you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

You will be integral to the development and success of our organization while also being able to take advantage of the many meaningful, career-developing opportunities you’ll be provided.


Who you are
  • You have delivered high quality, production systems at scale — so you know what it takes

Ultimately, our ideal candidate is someone who is highly organized and strives to get things done efficiently in a fast-moving environment with a solid technical background.

MirageID provides a unique privacy browser that caters to a niche market. We are looking for developers to help us build our next-gen browser version. Our ideal developer is a security-minded, technology flexible, problem solver who can jump on and solve the next challenge whatever the area of expertise. It's not about what you know, but what you can learn! We need to modify the deep internals of a browser? You can figure it out! We need to reverse engineer a DNS resolver to prevent leaks? results.text:
Über die Rolle
Millionen von Menschen entdecken mit der Komoot App die Natur. Wir helfen ihnen dabei, spannende Ziele und die besten Wanderungen und Fahrradtouren zu finden. Werde Teil unseres Autoren-Teams und schreibe informative und inspirierende Texte zu Mountainbike-, Fahrrad- und Wanderzielen weltweit. Arbeite dabei zeitlich flexibel und ortsunabhängig auf freiberuflicher Basis.

Deine Aufgabe
  • Schreibe einzigartige, inspirierende Inhalte für unsere Wander-, Mountainbike- oder Fahrrad-Guides und für unsere Highlights. (Du weißt nicht genau, wie die aussehen? Hier ist ein Beispiel für unsere Guides und hier ist ein Beispiel unserer Highlights.)
  • Beschreibe dabei die wichtigsten Aspekte einer Region/eines Orts, einschließlich der unbedingt zu besuchenden Natursehenswürdigkeiten, der Landschaft und der Infrastruktur zum Wandern und Radfahren
  • Recherchiere gut und gründlich, bis du das Thema, über das Du schreibst, wie deine Westentasche kennst
  • Schreibe einfach und verständlich im Stil von Komoot und berücksichtige dabei die wichtigsten SEO-Keywords
  • Unterstütze beim Feinschliff der Inhalte und veröffentliche sie auf unserer Plattform

Warum Du es lieben wirst
  • Verbinde Deine größten Leidenschaften: Outdoor, Recherche und Schreiben
  • Deine Texte inspirieren bei Komoot Millionen von Menschen zu neuen Outdoor-Abenteuern
  • Arbeite, wo es Dir am besten gefällt: Am Strand, in den Bergen, von zu Hause oder von unterwegs
  • Gehe einer kreativen und verantwortungsvollen Tätigkeit nach – mit größtmöglicher Flexibilität und fairer Bezahlung

Du wirst erfolgreich sein, wenn Du
  • Selbst begeisterter Mountainbiker, Wanderer oder Radfahrer bist
  • Bereits Erfahrung als Freelancer in der Outdoor Branche gesammelt hast
  • Spritzige und grammatikalisch einwandfreie deutsche Texte schreibst
  • Fließend Englisch sprichst
  • Gut und gründlich recherchierst und ein Briefing genauestens umzusetzen kannst
  • Mindestens Artikel mit insgesamt 3,000 Wörter pro Woche für uns schreiben kannst

Klingt genau nach Dir? Dann schick uns
  • Deinen Lebenslauf
  • Relevante Beispiele Deiner bisherigen Outdoor Texte
  • Deine Gehaltsvorstellungen und wie viel Du für uns arbeiten möchtest

About the role
The backbone of komoot is a huge repository of route recommendations and outdoor tips; handmade Collections built by passionate outdoor editors with a wealth of experience in their sports. To help inspire our growing community in Italy through the best outdoor content, we’re looking to build a team of native-level Italian-speaking freelance outdoor editors.

What you will do
  • Create unique, inspiring content for our Collections (https://www.komoot.com/collection/902010) and Guides (https://www.komoot.com/guide/40898)
  • Use your knowledge of the most popular official bike routes, the best singletracks or gravel routes, the toughest climbs or the most beautiful hikes to inspire our Italian-speaking user base
  • Independently build amazing routes on komoot
  • Research and create relevant Highlights for mountain bikers, cyclists, bike tourers and hikers
  • Review, rate and edit existing Highlights based on our quality standards
  • Describe the most important aspects of a region such as its landscape, history, top attractions or infrastructure in a way that is useful and inspirational for hikers and cyclists.
  • Write copy that’s easily understandable, SEO optimized and adheres to komoot's writing style
  • Tell the stories of these routes and places — and some of your own adventures — to get our Italian-speaking users dreaming and active!

Why you will love it
  • You will utilize all of your greatest passions: The outdoors, researching, route-planning and writing
  • Your stories will inspire millions of people, from seasoned outdoor-lovers to novice hikers and cyclists, and they’ll help establish our community in Italy
  • We encourage you to work from wherever you want, be that on a beach, in the mountains, from home, or anywhere that lies between the time zones UTC-1 and UTC+3
  • Enjoy a creative and responsible role that offers a great amount of flexibility

You will be successful in this position if
  • You are a passionate outdoor editor with a minimum of 2 years experience
  • You feel at home online and always adopt the latest tools to improve your own efficiency
  • You are an experienced mountain biker, cyclist, hiker, trail runner or bike tourer, and know the local cycling and hiking hotspots like the back of your hand
  • You love planning routes for yourself and your peers
  • You are available to work for komoot for a minimum of 20 hours per week
  • You speak Italian on a native level in addition to writing and speaking excellent English
  • You can write snappy and grammatically correct Italian copy
  • You are highly motivated, excited about taking on additional responsibilities, and are structured and target-oriented in your approach to tasks

Sound like you?
We would love to hear from you!

  • Your CV in English highlighting your most relevant experience
  • A brief description in English explaining why you’d like to work at komoot
  • Something to demonstrate your passion for the outdoors, be it a snippet from your blog, YouTube or Instagram account
  • Three examples of relevant projects you’ve worked on to date (published articles, blog posts, campaigns, etc.).
  • Your availability (hours/week)
  • Your suggestion for a Collection which you think our Italian-speaking users absolutely need to see. Details here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1DqQzKBOlIh9pnaHPd4Zhg4NG4dhaNKnRjHiuAzg-ZBo/edit?usp=sharing

Description

At Fleetio, we believe that building great software requires great product management. As a Product Manager, it’s your job to move the product forward in search of happy and productive customers. This is a demanding but rewarding role that requires an abundance of curiosity, skill, and leadership.

Fleetio is a modern software platform that helps thousands of organizations around the world manage a fleet. Transportation technology is a hot market and we’re leading the charge, with raving fans and new customers signing up every day.

You’ll own key parts of the software development process: researching the details of how something should work, defining and prioritizing user stories, talking to customers, and working with product designers and engineers to build remarkable solutions.

Product Management is a fairly technical role at Fleetio. While you won’t be coding, we expect PMs to have a fundamental understanding of how web applications and many of the underlying technologies work. You should be comfortable with data - knowing how to instrument systems to collect data and building queries to analyze it.


What you'll be doing
  • Talk to customers and know the market, the product line, and the competition extremely well. You’ll learn to finish our customers’ sentences, which means talking to a lot of them in order to understand the root of a problem — and all variations of it.
  • Make strategic decisions. You will be expected to build and execute a product roadmap that achieves a strategic vision. The product manager is the decision-maker, the person who can take a variety of inputs and skillfully decide what actions must take place immediately, next, and never.
  • Research and spec out how things should work. Explain the obvious. Engineering shouldn’t have to ask a million questions when they start working on a feature.
  • Organize feedback, bugs, and ideas into a development backlog. You’ll use tools like Balsamiq or Figma to prototype creative solutions and work with designers and developers to refine and implement them.
  • Communicate internally and externally. You will help write documentation, deliver updates to other Fleetio teams, craft marketing messaging, assemble presentations, contribute to white papers, and more.

What's in it for you
  • Build software used by users all around the world. So many different types of companies and organizations operate a fleet each day, and Fleetio is a good fit for most of them (it’s a huge market).
  • Be a part of an incredible team of “A” players who go above and beyond to make Fleetio a successful company. We’re a customer-centric team with a great product, excellent support, and countless happy customers.
  • Work remotely (within the United States), or at our Birmingham, AL HQ. About half of our product, engineering, and design team work remotely, and as a company, we strive to promote a strong remote working culture and have done so since the beginning (2012).

More about our team and company:
  • Watch our culture videos: https://fleet.io/culture
  • Fleetio overview video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IlvIbwZT3oU
  • More about the Fleetio platform: https://www.fleetio.com/features
  • Our careers page: https://www.fleetio.com/careers

Requirements
  • 3+ years in a product management or UX development (or closely related) role on an agile software team. Should you not meet the experience requirements but have true Product Management experience, we still encourage you to apply.
  • Strong strategic decision-making — you will need to decide what to build and why — which isn't just about listening to customers tell you what features they want.
  • Strong technical background that enables you to convey product requirements to engineers and relay complicated details to non-technical colleagues and customers.
  • Natural leadership and influence, even when you don’t have direct authority over others within an organization.
  • Excellent organization and communication skills — this role is all about communicating while efficiently managing projects with many moving parts.
  • “Spidey-sense” product instinct and creativity. Able to suggest approaches that nobody on the team has thought of, but immediately strike everyone as obvious when they hear them.
  • Fundamental understanding of good UX design — you’re compelled to make things look beautiful and work flawlessly.
  • Natural curiosity and empathy — always looking to deeply understand problems and challenges.
  • Level up if you know a thing or two about cars, fleet management, vehicle maintenance, or related industries.
  • Be sure to mention coffee in your cover letter so we know you actually read this

Benefits
  • 100% coverage of employee health and dental insurance (50% family)
  • 401(k) + match
  • Company stock options
  • Vision, STD & LTD
  • Dependent Care FSA and Medical FSA
  • Generous PTO, Company Holidays & Floating Holiday
  • Maternity/Paternity leave
  • Community service funds
  • Mac laptop
  • Professional development funds
  • Health and wellness incentives
  • Remote working friendly since 2012

results.role: Data Quality Manager (f/m/x) // Seven Senders GmbH
results.text:
About us Seven Senders is the leading delivery platform to ship parcels. The company connects shippers with its carrier network of over 100 carriers in Europe, enabling them to use excellent local shipping as a competitive advantage. With additional delivery services such as Claims Center, Insurance, Return Portal and Labels, Seven Senders makes international shipping a simple matter. Automated shipping notifications, tracking and monitoring solutions ensure a transparent shipping process. Monthly reports and analyses enable data-based optimization of international shipping performance. Shippers receive everything from a single source and reduce complexity. You have an impact on the following topics As a Data Quality Manager (f/m/x), you will be responsible for our information assets and will continually ensure the quality of selected data (e.g. last mile carrier tracking data). The main responsibility of this role is to surface any data quality issue proactively and assess the impact of data latencies or other service disruptions that can negatively impact our clients. You will actively participate in the day-to day business operations as a member of our technical support team and will support with the the following topics:
  • Monitor and maintain accuracy of incoming data (e.g. last mile carrier tracking data) throughout the client’s lifecycle
  • Devise and implement efficient and secure procedures for data quality assurance
  • Ensure data harmonization by synchronizing data points across products and making it available for the internal/external consumption
  • Create and follow-up on data quality reports
  • Support with with data related 1st and 2nd level support requests
